title: Harm Reduction Coordinator
description:
**Job Title:** Harm Reduction Coordinator

**Job Summary:**

The Harm Reduction Coordinator is responsible for assisting with the day-to-day management of the harm reduction programs which include the Harm Reduction Services (HRS) and the Syringe Services Program (SSP).

The Coordinator manages the work of the members of the harm reduction services team. The Coordinator is also responsible for coaching, resolving issues, and serving as a link between team members and upper management.

*Primary Duties & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*

* Provide regular and consistent supervision, evaluation, professional development, and oversight of HRS team members.
* Assist with the monitoring and management of the BOOM!Health Harm Reduction Center.
* Proven background in case management.
* Management of the HRS case manager(s),review of HRS participant records, record reviews, performance measures and goal setting.
* Participate in any program evaluation, site-visit by funders, phone calls, check-ins and meetings related to the management of HRS services.
* Along with senior managers, develop work schedules for the harm reduction team.
* Set individual staff monthly and annual performance goals in direct correlation to contract deliverables.
* Ensure that each team member understands their job function, their duties, and expected performance goals.
* Monitor employee productivity and provide constructive feedback and coaching.
* Assist with the development and regular updates of the HRS and SSP daily schedule.
* Assist with scheduling of the mobile SSP fixed site locations, peer specialist schedules, and outreach activities and locations.
* Manage syringe litter clean-up events and provide guidance to the park clean-up team.
* Assist with Quality Assurance (QA) activities and ongoing review of program activity logs and documentation.
* Establish relationships with outside service providers through Letters of Agreement, Memorandum of Understanding, and Linkage Agreements.

**Qualifications/Criteria:**

* 2 or more years of management experience.
* Working knowledge of harm reduction theory and practice.
* Experience with the provision of harm reduction services to active drug users, the homeless, and sex workers.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule when necessary.
* Proven experience as a manager.
* Maintain personnel supervision records.
* Pass on information from upper management to employees and vice versa.
* Prepare and submit performance reports and performance appraisals.
* Participate in the interview process and training of new employees.
* Good writing skills are required.
* Plan agency outreach strategies, times, locations, and activities.
* Ensure adherence to legal and company policies and procedures and undertake disciplinary actions if the need arises.
* Responsible for ordering, receiving, and safe storage of harm reduction supplies.
* Working knowledge of AIRS and eShare.
* Good knowledge of MS Office.
* Demonstrated commitment to advocacy and activism, particularly in the crises of COVID-19, HIV/AIDS, homelessness, and drug policy.
* Represent the agency at meetings.
* Attend all required training.
* Assign team members to required trainings.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Able to work a flexible schedule when necessary, including occasional Saturday’s.
* Bilingual (English and Spanish) preferred.
* Valid NYS driver’s license (3 years NYS driving experience).

**Education:**

* Bachelor’s degree is preferred. Not required with 2 or more years of management experience.

BOOM!HEALTH is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals who have personal experience with drug use, PLWHA, women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, and the formerly incarcerated are strongly encouraged to apply

Please visit our website: www.boomhealth.org for information about the company.

* Compensation competitive; based on clinical ability & experience.
* Excellent benefits, including Major Medical, Dental, Pension match after 1 year.
* Close to all public transportation.

We are a Drug-Free Workplace. All candidates are subject to a drug test.

NYC law prohibits us from requiring you to share information about your current or past salary. Although we may discuss salary expectations with you, you should not interpret any of our questions as seeking or requiring information about your current or past salary.

title: Front Office Supervisor
description:
**Job Description**

Directly supervises all front office personnel and ensures proper completion of all front office duties. Directs and coordinates the activities of the front desk, reservations, guest services, and telephone areas. Prepare monthly reports and budget for front office department.

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Trains, cross –trains, and retrains all front office personnel.
* Participates in the selection of front office personnel.
* Schedules the front office staff.
* Supervises workload during shifts.
* Maintains working relationships and communicates with all departments.
* Verifies that accurate room status information is maintained and properly communicated.
* Resolves guest problems quickly, efficiently, and courteously.
* Ensure desk delivers outstanding guest service.
* Updates group information. Maintains, monitors, and prepares group requirements. Relays information to appropriate personnel.
* Reviews and updates Company Profiles/Direct Bills.
* Monitors and responds to all guest reviews and brings any guest issues and/or concerns to the attention of the GM and Front Office Manager on a daily basis.
* Enforces all cash-handling, check-cashing, and credit policies.
* Wears the proper uniform at all times and requires all front office employees to wear proper uniforms at all times.
* Upholds the hotel's commitment to hospitality.
* Maximize room revenue and occupancy by reviewing status daily. Analyze rate variance, monitor credit report and maintain close observation of daily house count.
* Monitor selling status of house daily, flash report, allowance etc.
* Monitor high balance guest(s) and take appropriate action.
* Ensure implementation of all hotel policies and house rules.
* Operate all aspects of front office computer system, including software maintenance, report generation and analysis, and simple configuration changes.
* Ensure logging and delivery of all messages, packages, and mail in a timely and professional manner.
* Ensure that employees are, at all times, attentive, friendly, helpful and courteous to all guests, managers and other employees.
* Monitor all V.I.P 's special guests and requests.
* Maintain required pars of all front office and stationary supplies.
* Review daily front office work and activity reports generated by Night Audit.
* Review Front office log book and Guest feedback forms on a daily basis.
* Maintain an organized and comprehensive filing system with documentation of purchases, vouchering, schedules, forecasts, reports and tracking logs.
* Coordinate with housekeeping, maintenance, and sales manager.
* As a working Supervisor, you will be expected to cover shifts as needed based on occupancy and labor budget. In addition, you will be responsible for coverage of call off, or to coordinate with staff for coverage.
* Perform other duties as requested by management.

**REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Minimum of high school diploma or equivalent.
* 2-3 years of working in a hotel experience -- ***must be on resume to be considered.*** .
* Opera PMS system experience (*preferred*).
* 1 - 2 years of supervisory/managerial experience -- ***must be on resume to be considered.***

title: Digital Value Stream Delivery and Transformation Lead
description:
**Location – New York**

This is a hybrid position primarily based in New York. We’re committed to your flexibility and wellbeing and our hybrid strategy currently requires three days a week in the office, giving you the option to work remotely for some of your working week. Find out more about our culture of flexible working .  



**We give you a world of potential**

Computershare have a very exciting opportunity for a Digital Value Stream Delivery and Transformation Lead to join our team in New York.


Why is this role exciting when there are so many other positions in the market? Well, there are a few things that make this role stand out:


* You will be joining a global business during an ambitious global Digital Transformation Programme and will be responsible for leading the build of digital products deployed globally.
* You will be embarking on a leadership journey where you will transform the experiences of customers, clients, and our own employees through the delivery of digital applications using leading-edge technology shaping the future of technology and innovation at Computershare.

Interested? Keep on reading to find out a bit more about what you’ll be doing, and the type of person that we’re looking for.  



**A role you will love**

As one of our Digital Value Stream Delivery and Transformation Leads, you will be leading and managing the development and delivery of customer and client-facing digital applications, ensuring alignment with our strategic goals.


You will be part of a digital transformation programme that will deliver industry leading products and features, including:


* Digitising Operations and Call Centre transactions (e.g., onboarding, servicing, sales, transfers)
* Building state of the art mobile applications for customers
* B2C mobile and browser channels in Financial Services
* B2B Client applications such as investor portals, applications, or new channels in Financial Services
* Digital identity and authentication (e.g., MFA, social login)
Leading edge AI and data applications  
* 

The role involves having a deep understanding of designing, implementing and managing end-to-end customer journeys in financial services and delivering multi-channel experiences to our clients and customers.


Some key responsibilities include:


* Develop and communicate a clear vision and strategy for the value stream, aligned with the overall transformation programme
* Captain a diverse team of experts, guiding them to develop and launch stellar customer and client-facing digital applications.
* Overseeing the planning, execution, and delivery of digital application projects within the value stream.
* Managing the project lifecycle, from ideation and requirements gathering to development, testing, and deployment.
* Fostering a culture of innovation within the value stream, encouraging the exploration of new technologies and methodologies.
Acting as the primary point of contact for stakeholders, including senior leadership, business units, and external partners.  
* 

**What will you bring to the role?**

As you’ve probably gathered by now, we are looking for somebody with a real passion for leading and delivering complex digital transformations, ideally in financial services (banking, asset management, brokering or issuer services).


With this role being a key part of our Digital Transformation, we are looking for someone with strong analytical skills alongside the ability to think creatively and outside the box to develop innovative solutions to challenging issues. As this is a global role you will also be highly experienced in managing and building excellent stakeholder relationships with people at all levels.


Other key skills required for the role include:


* Deep understanding of customer and client identity, end-to-end customer journeys in financial services, and multi-channel experiences in financial services
* An understanding of modern ways of working such as Agile and/or SAFe
* A solid understanding of the industry landscape, including market trends, customer needs, and competitive dynamics
* Comprehensive understanding of key transformation outcomes such as revenue growth, cost reduction, customer satisfaction
* Familiarity with digital development platforms and frameworks (e.g. JavaScript, HTML/CSS, React, Angular, etc)
* An understanding of cloud technologies (e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and DevOps practices.

If this sounds like just the role you’ve been looking for, be sure to apply today!

title: Digital Product Owner
description:
**Location – New York**

This is a hybrid position primarily based in New York. We’re committed to your flexibility and wellbeing and our hybrid strategy currently requires three days a week in the office, giving you the option to work remotely for some of your working week. Find out more about our culture of flexible working .  



**We give you a world of potential**

Computershare have a very exciting opportunity for a Digital Product Owner to join our team in New York.


Why is this role exciting when there are so many other Digital Product Owner positions in the market? Well, there are a few things that make this role stand out:


* You will be joining a global business during an ambitious global Digital Transformation Programme.
* You will be embarking on a journey where you will continue to develop professionally as you influence the experiences of customers, clients and our own employees through the delivery of digital applications using leading-edge technology, shaping the future of technology and innovation at Computershare.

Interested? Keep on reading to find out a bit more about what you’ll be doing, and the type of person that we’re looking for.  



**A role you will love**

As one of our Digital Product Owners, you will be the voice of our customer within our squads and will be responsible for ensuring the product features and functionality are aligned to the customer’s needs to deliver maximum value and results, elevating our digital journey and directly influencing our digital strategy.


You will be part of a digital transformation programme that will deliver industry leading products and features, including:


* Digitising Operations and Call Centre transactions (e.g., onboarding, servicing, sales, transfers)
* Building state of the art mobile applications for customers
* Development of B2C mobile and browser channels in Financial Services
Development and implementation of B2B Client applications such as investor portals, applications, or new channels in Financial Services  
* 

Your mission will be to work with the Digital Value Stream Delivery and Transformation Lead to translate business objectives and user needs into a strategic product roadmap, ensuring it aligns with our overarching transformation goals. You’ll also prioritize product features and enhancements, weighing customer feedback, business impact, and strategic importance to deliver a product that drives our digital evolution forward.


Some key responsibilities include:


* Work closely with the Digital Value Stream Delivery and Transformation Lead to break down the digital strategy vision into detailed product roadmaps with clear requirements.
* Act as the primary liaison between the development team and business stakeholders to gather and document detailed product requirements, ensuring transparency and alignment throughout the project lifecycle.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams including designers, developers, testers, and marketers from initial concept through to launch and post-launch iterations, to ensure successful product delivery on time that meets high quality standards.
Advocate for the end-user experience, ensuring that the product meets or exceeds customer expectations while collaborating with UX/UI designer to create intuitive and engaging user interfaces that are thoroughly tested with QA teams before release.  
* 

**What will you bring to the role?**

As you’ve probably gathered by now, we are looking for an innovative and detail-oriented person with a real passion for Digital Product Ownership. We are looking for a natural mentor and leader, who has the ability to build and manage excellent relationships with all of our stakeholders and technology teams to deliver exceptional products.


With this role being global and a key part of our Digital Transformation, we are looking for someone with product ownership experience in complex digital transformation with a background in financial services, banking, consulting, asset management, brokering, issuer services, customer service and/or contact centres.


Other key skills required for the role include:


* A team player who works successfully with the delivery squads and wider teams to achieve the goals and objectives of the digital transformation.
* Knowledge & experience in modern ways of working including Agile requirements techniques including Personas, Story Mapping, Product Roadmaps, Backlog Management, etc.
* Significant domain knowledge and the ability to share knowledge of industry best practices and apply technical experience to resolve problems as well as analyse complex material/data and organise this in presentable formats.
* Proficiency in product management tools and software, such as JIRA, Trello, or similar platforms. Familiarity with software development processes and frameworks (e.g., JavaScript, HTML/CSS, React, Angular, etc.).
* Understanding of modern cloud technologies (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), AI and DevOps practices.
* Certification as a Product Owner or equivalent is **desirable.**
Extensive experience of liaising with stakeholders of all levels to understand their needs, and is a strong communicator and facilitator with strong negotiation skills to support the brokering of agreements.  
* 

If this sounds like just the role you’ve been looking for, be sure to apply today!


**Rewards designed for you**

**Paid parental leave** , flexible working and a caring and inclusive culture.


**Health and wellbeing** rewards that can be tailored to support you and your family, including medical, dental and vision.


**Invest in your future** with 401k matching and tax-advantaged flexible spending plans, including healthcare, dependent care and commuter.


**Income protection** . Our package includes short and long-term disability benefits, life insurance and supplemental life insurance.


**And more.** Ours is a welcoming and close-knit community, with experienced colleagues ready to help you grow. Our handbook will help you find out more about our rewards and life at Computershare, visit computershare.com/careers-handbook.


**Compensation.** The typical base pay range for this role is $130,000 - $170,000. This base pay range is specific to these locations and may not be applicable to other locations: New York State

title: School Psychologist
description:
**SteppingStone Day School** 

Established in 1983, SteppingStone is a private, not for profit preschool program/ evaluation site for children with and without special needs. The agency's mission is to provide collaborative evaluations, education, therapy, and family support services so that young children can develop to their full potential and join with their families and friends as members of the community.

SteppingStone Day School's philosophy is based on the belief that all children are entitled to an education in a safe, nurturing and enriched environment with paramount emphasis on individualization and educational best practices. In addition, it is inherent in the school's philosophy that the incorporation of the needs of the family unit is essential to the young child's holistic growth.

We are seeking a Full-Time School Psychologist to work Monday to Friday

**School Psychologist** 

General

· Provide clinical counseling services to students as mandated on the IEP; monitor progress and maintain records

· Timely completion of reports and other paperwork

· Attend interdisciplinary team meetings

· Conduct classroom and/or student observations and data collection to assess need for behavioral supports and complete FBA & BIP if appropriate

· Monitor and track progress for children with behavior plans

· Develop necessary interventions for teachers and support staff to provide positive outcomes for students

· Implement school-wide PBIS and track progress

· Implement 2nd-Step Social-Emotional curriculum

· Provide crisis intervention as needed

· Provide staff workshops on various topics related to child development

· Coordinate care and resources with social workers

Parent collaboration

· Provide consultation to parents regarding specific strategies or behavior management/support

· Coordinate an Evening Meeting

· Provide feedback to parents regarding psychological or neuropsychological evaluations

· Discuss proposed program modifications

· Provide information for community resources

· Coordinate implementation of strategies used in school with family

Teacher consultation

· Consult with teachers and team members to assess the various factors / purpose of behaviors that may be affecting a student's learning experience

· Ongoing consultation with teachers regarding recommended strategies for behavior modification and/or classroom management

**REQUIRED:** 

**- Masters in School Psychology or higher** 

**- Experience with early childhood and behavior supports** 

**- Certified School Psychologist** 

**Location**: Kew Garden Hills, Queens

**Email Cover letter and CV to LindaS@steppingstonedayschool.org**

title: Preschool Family Worker
description:
Job Description

Family Worker

The Family Worker is responsible for coordinating services for children and families in compliance with standards set by the school district. A primary responsibility of the Family Worker is to connect the parents and the community with the Early Childhood Program.

Responsibilities of the Family Worker include:

· Establish healthy positive relationships with parents and children, and serve as a liaison between the Early Childhood Program and the home

· Be knowledgeable of community resources and be able to help families make linkages to needed social services.

· Work with program staff on developing programs that promote healthy child development and increase parental involvement.

· Attend all scheduled training required for the position.

· Attend scheduled individual and group supervision with Social Worker from designated agency.

· Provide case management services to families served by the program.

· Ensure that parents follow up on health service referrals, and identify health resources for families.

· Maintain contact with parents to insure student attendance is regular.

· Fully participate in all outreach and recruitment processes, which systematically ensures enrollment of all eligible children.

· Provide or ensure linkage with emergency assistance and crises intervention.

· Work cooperatively with community-based social service agencies to assist families in their own efforts to improve the conditions and quality of family life and ensure access to social services.

· Ensure confidentiality of all children and families is respected and upheld.

· Maintain organized records and complete paperwork in a timely fashion.

title: Part-Time Educator
description:
Who We Are:  
lululemon is an innovative performance apparel company for yoga, running, training, and other athletic pursuits. Setting the bar in technical fabrics and functional design, we create transformational products and experiences that support people in moving, growing, connecting, and being well. We owe our success to our innovative product, emphasis on stores, commitment to our people, and the incredible connections we make in every community we're in. As a company, we focus on creating positive change to build a healthier, thriving future. In particular, that includes creating an equitable, inclusive and growth-focused environment for our people.

Guest (i.e., Customer) Experience

* Interact with guests to ensure a great guest experience in a manner that values guests’ time.
* Assess guests’ needs to provide customized, effective purchase and return solutions and support.
* Provide technical product education by articulating the value and benefit of the product.
* Facilitate a seamless end-to-end guest experience by conducting accurate and timely guest transactions and executing market-relevant omnichannel programs (e.g., buy online/pickup in store, phone sales, and ship from store options) according to company standards.
* Move dynamically on the floor to continuously engage with guests and attend to guest or store needs.
* Receive guest feedback and partner with store leadership to take appropriate action and “make it right” for guests.

Working with Others

* Contribute to a respectful and inclusive team environment by welcoming and celebrating differences to ensure a supportive and engaging experience for all team members and guests.
* Establish supportive and productive relationships with all team members.
* Collaborate with team members to ensure optimal guest experience and support store operations.

Operations

* Perform product presentation tasks (e.g., put items back in place, restock or add depleted items to the floor from inventory, destock or relocate items) according to company standards.
* Use in-store technology to support store operations and provide positive guest experiences.
* Perform cleaning tasks as needed throughout the shift to maintain the luxury environment of the store.
* Understand and adhere to people safety policies and procedures to maintain a safe work environment.
* Perform work in accordance with applicable policies, procedures, and laws or regulations.

Key Skills & Core Values You Bring

* Inclusion & Diversity:Creates/supports an inclusive environment that values/celebrates differences
* Integrity/Honesty: Behaves in an honest, fair, and ethical manner
* Guest Experience: Enjoys working and connecting with, understanding, and helping guests
* Personal Responsibility:Accepts responsibility/accountability for actions; is dependable
* Self-Awareness: Is aware of how words or actions may be perceived by or affect others
* Collaboration and Teamwork:Works productively with others to achieve goals; seeks diverse perspectives
* Enthusiasm: Is enthusiastic about one’s own work; looks for ways to make work fun and engaging

Job Requirements  
Eligibility

* Must be legally authorized to work in the country in which the store is located
* Must be 18 years of age or older
* Must have proof of the Right to Work and evidence relating to associated local legislative requirements (EMEA only)
* Must have the ability to travel to assigned store with own transportation methods

Availability

* Willing to work a flexible schedule including evenings, weekends, and holidays

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $18.50 per hour

Benefits:

* Flexible schedule
* Paid time off

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

description:

Our Dental Assistants take x-rays, sterilize and disinfect instruments and equipment, prepare the instruments and materials required to treat each patient, and obtain patients' dental records. title: Property Manager
description:
**Overview**

Rose Associates is a leading name in real estate innovation, providing dynamic services in development, management, leasing, and marketing globally. With almost a century of expertise in New York City's unique market, we're seeking a skilled Property Manager to oversee leasing, ensure resident satisfaction, and optimize financial performance at this incredible lease-up community. Join us in shaping vibrant living spaces and advancing your property management career.

**Essential Job Functions**

* Engage stakeholders promptly to enhance client satisfaction and project completion.
* Manage lease enforcement, sales, and marketing initiatives to meet occupancy targets.
* Supervise resident retention programs and address concerns effectively.
* Collaborate with internal departments and set staff goals.
* Oversee community inspections, maintenance, and vendor coordination.
* Ensure compliance with policies and procedures and handle emergencies.
* Contribute to budget preparation and analyze financial performance.
* Process invoices and maintain positive resident relationships.
* Must be present on-site and be able to move throughout the building to address community-related matters, including exceptional communication skills to meet with tenants, staff, vendors and visitors.
* Ability to ascend and descend stairs and be comfortable with exposure to varying environmental climates and circumstances.
* Position may be required to perform duties outside their normal responsibilities as needed.

**Qualifications**

* Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, real estate, or finance or equivalent experience.
* A minimum of 5 years of multifamily property management experience is required.
* Proficiency in navigating computers and community management software, to include Microsoft Office include iLuvLeasing, On-Site, and Yardi.
* Technical knowledge of building operations and maintenance.
* Understanding of marketing trends, budgeting, and reporting, including strong financial skills with knowledge of GAAP.
* Valid NYS real estate license is required or ability to obtain one within the first 120 days of employment. All active license holders must register their license with the Company upon hire.

title: Customer Service Specialist - Contract and Hospitality markets
description:
**COMPANY PROFILE:**

*Founded in 1976, Dedar is a "fabric house" that expresses a personal style with its cutting-edge contemporary collections. Located close to Como, Dedar experiments and innovates to attain product perfection through an ongoing dialogue with those craftsmen and textile specialists who are most familiar with the techniques employed in producing excellent fabrics.*

*Characterized by seductive color palettes and unexpected patterns, Dedar's fabrics combine precious yarns with research into fiber technology to offer various solutions for curtains, upholstery, and wall covering of timeless elegance.*

*Just 20 people 20 years ago, Dedar has grown to be an international team of more than 200 employees today: a group that keeps growing with the company, sharing the same passion for beautiful textiles. Dedar serves over 80 countries and operates directly in Italy, France, the UK, the USA, UAE, Germany, and several dealers and distributors.*

**PURPOSE:**

We are looking for a Customer Service Specialist who will work closely with the contract and hospitality sales representatives, providing daily support to achieve tactical commercial goals and develop the contract and hospitality business within the North American territory.

The Customer Service Specialist will be responsible for managing US Contract projects (hospitality/luxury/motion) by overseeing all phases of order management and ensuring customer satisfaction following company guidelines and expectations.

Responsibilities will focus on managing orders throughout the entire sales cycle.

**DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

Main activities:

* Communicating directly with sales representatives, specifying design firms, furniture dealers, procurement offices, and purchasing agencies, and facilitating a close working relationship between the sales representative and these outside agencies.
* Responsible for responding, in partnership with management and sales representatives, to all requests for quote (RFQ) and requests for price (RFP).
* Managing the order process from customer request to post-sale service. This includes sample and project orders, reserves, prices and offers, stock check availability, and product information.
* Become highly knowledgeable on company products and offerings, including special products and the technical aspects of commercial and hospitality applications. This includes independent fabric treatments and third-party laboratory certification testing.
* Assuring an updated project portfolio while maintaining accurate and up-to-date project/sales reports.
* Tracking price offers and project-specific commission agreements following commercial strategies and management guidelines.
* Managing process relationships with accounting, production, and delivery departments to ensure continuous checks on open projects.

**EXPERIENCE & SKILLS:**

* Associate or bachelor’s degree preferred;
* Industry experience with a minimum of five years of customer service/sales experience working for a commercial textile or furniture manufacturer/dealer;
* Knowledge of interior architecture and design processes and building codes as they pertain to FF&E specifications.
* Computer savvy with strong Office 365 skillset;
* An ability to develop and manage effective relationships and a strong willingness to listen actively;

title: Community Health Outreach Worker
description:
**Job Title:** Community Health Outreach Worker

**Job Summary:**

Provide outreach services in the Bronx and at the Harm Reduction Center for program recruitment and retention, including distribution of health education and risk reduction information and safe injection equipment and other supplies to people who use drugs.

*Primary Duties & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*

* Follow NYSDOH and our organization’s protocols for Syringe Exchange.
* Follow NYSDOH safety guidelines as trained for handling biohazard waste.
* Conduct Syringe exchange program enrollment, including review of substance use history, current drug use practices, medical waste disposal practices, and providing low-threshold counseling and education to participants within the agency and on the mobile unit.
* Respond appropriately to emergency situations that may be encountered in the field in accordance with training received including overdoses.
* Serve as agency liaison at community forums, events, and planning bodies as appropriate and where assigned.
* Data collection is required.
* Conduct Opioid Overdose Reversal Training.
* Explain, describe, and discuss safer injection practices, other safe drug using strategies, and safer sex options.
* Provision of and documentation of prevention education, counseling, referrals, safer drug using education, and strategies.
* Street-level outreach for program recruitment and retention, including distribution of health education and risk reduction information.
* Respond appropriately to emergency situations that may be encountered in the field in accordance with training received including overdoses.
* Maintain accurate and legible paperwork for all syringe exchange/overdose prevention activities.
* Provide referrals to the Argus Community programs.
* Act as a point person for Buprenorphine referrals and information
* Conduct rapid HIV and Hepatitis C on the mobile unit.
* Responsible for ensuring medical waste is handled properly, packed, and stored in a designated area.
* Preparation, packing, and inventory of syringes and related program supplies.
* Provision of and documentation of prevention education, counseling, referrals, safer drug using education, and strategies.
* Distribute high-risk prevention supplies, including female & male condoms, safer smoking kits, and provision of sterile syringes.
* Assist in monitoring the inventory and ordering harm reduction supplies.
* Assist in stocking mobile outreach unit.

**Qualifications/Criteria:**

* Minimum of one year of experience providing harm reduction counseling, referrals, prevention education, safer substance user strategies, and education.
* Must participate in required training, webinars, and other training requirements.
* Knowledge of infectious disease transmission and prevention practices for injectors (HIV, Hepatitis C, Opiate Over Dose Prevention and Response) health education, outreach strategies, harm reduction theory, and practice.
* Must be able to effectively engage individuals in the community and provide risk reduction education and counseling.
* Must be knowledgeable about Buprenorphine and other medication-assisted treatment or the ability to attend training.
* Good communication skills oral, written, and interpersonal skills.
* Some computer skills are required including experience using MS Word.
* Bilingual (English/Spanish) is preferred.
* Available to work a flexible schedule, including afternoons, evening, and weekend rotations.
* Physically able to climb stairs, move and lift boxes and supply packs weighing up to 20 pounds.

**Education:**

* A High School diploma or GED is required.

BOOM!HEALTH is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Individuals who have personal experience with drug use, PLWHA, women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, and the formerly incarcerated are strongly encouraged to apply

Please visit our website: www.boomhealth.org for information about the company.

* Compensation competitive; based on clinical ability & experience.
* Excellent benefits, including Major Medical, Dental, Pension match after 1 year.

title: Part Time Veterinarian
description:
You will be responsible for preventative care, the diagnosis and treatment of minor illnesses/injuries, and the diagnosis and management of chronic medical conditions. Your job will also entail educating clients and developing strong client relationships. You will have 2-3 veterinary assistants or technicians to assist you with this throughout the day. We offer affordable pricing and transparency to our clients. Just like your family physician, you will work with neighboring veterinary practices for pets that require emergency care, hospitalization, imaging, dentistry, surgery, or end of life care. We simply make primary care easy so you can help the most pets.

We are currently looking for candidates to work in our Paramus, Green Brook and Union locations.

**Why you should work with PetWellClinic:**

· There is no on-call or after-hours care.

· You will get to focus on one pet at a time because there are no emergencies, ringing telephones, and hospitalized patients to divide your time between.

· Because there are no scheduled appointments, you will never feel rushed or like you are “running behind”.

· You will have plenty of staff to support you throughout the day.

· We strive to create a culture of openness, warmth, kindness, diversity, and compassion. Because of this, you will feel like you are working with your second family.

· We offer a competitive salary, bonus pay, 401K with matching, health insurance, CE stipend, VIN membership, and paid time off

**Responsibilities:**

You will be responsible for preventative care, the diagnosis and treatment of minor illnesses/injuries, and the diagnosis and management of chronic medical conditions. Your job will also entail educating clients and developing strong client relationships. You will have 2-3 veterinary assistants or technicians to assist you with this throughout the day.

We are currently looking for candidates to work in our Paramus location and Union. We will have a fourth location TBD that will be opening within the year.

**Why you should work with PetWellClinic:**

· Full-time employees will not work more than 45 hours per week.

· There is no on-call or after-hours care.

· You will get to focus on one pet at a time because there are no emergencies, ringing telephones, and hospitalized patients to divide your time between.

· Because there are no scheduled appointments, you will never feel rushed or like you are “running behind”.

· You will have plenty of staff to support you throughout the day. You will often be working as the only veterinarian in the practice.

· We strive to create a culture of openness, warmth, kindness, diversity, and compassion. Because of this, you will feel like you are working with your second family.

· We offer a competitive salary, bonus pay, 401K with matching, health insurance, CE stipend, VIN membership, and paid time off.

title: Financial Analyst, FP&A (Hybrid)
description:
**Job Description:**


**About Us:**



Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world's largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America's largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron's, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor's Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).


**About the Role:**



The FP&A group is currently seeking a Finance Analyst to support the business focusing on financial planning and consolidation. You will help develop, communicate and monitor departmental budgets. This dynamic and fast-paced role will provide strategic business partner support and financial support with a focus on reporting and forecasting and support for strategic projects. You will report to the Manager of Finance and be based in our New York City or Princeton office.


**You Will:**


* Work closely with business partners to review and prepare budgets and forecasts.
* Update and run forecast models and scenario planning.
* Develop business case models, charts, and reporting dashboards to provide analysis and insights to evaluate the financial impact of decisions for senior management.
* Handle month-end closing activities, including, journal entry preparation, account analysis, and reclasses.
* Leverage key systems knowledge (SAP, BPC) to facilitate the creation of more robust analytics and reporting tools, which ultimately drive valuable insights as well as more efficient planning & reporting processes.
* Build and maintain strong business partner relationships with cross-functional teams and key stakeholders.
* Identify opportunities to improve internal processes, improve work efficiency and quality.
* Handle additional ad-hoc requests as deemed necessary by the business or financial needs.

**You Have:**


* Strong accounting and analytical skills; Bachelor’s degree in finance or accounting (preferred).
* High degree of proficiency in PC skills including experience with financial applications and reporting tools, specifically Microsoft Excel (can perform complex functions) and Google Docs.
* Planning, project management, and organizational skills including effective time management and attention to detail.
* Initiative and drive and work well under pressure including being a team player with a strong work ethic.
* Experience maintaining accounting records and preparation of financial reports
* Ability to recognize problems, collect data, draw valid conclusions and define/suggest resolutions.
* Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with diverse groups of business partners.
* Knowledge of or experience with SAP, TM1, or related programs (a plus).
* 0-3 years of experience.
* Demonstrated experience navigating a complex and challenging business environment.
* Analytical expertise, able to synthesize data and provide insightful narratives.
* Ability to multi-task and effectively balance multiple priorities and deadlines.
* Experience in ERP systems (TM1, Alteryx), (a plus).

**Our Benefits**


* Comprehensive Healthcare Plans
* Paid Time Off
* Retirement Plans
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance Plans
* Education Benefits
* Paid Maternity and Paternity Leave
* Family Care Benefits
* Commuter Transit Program
* Subscription Discounts
* Employee Referral Program

Learn more about all ourUS benefits



Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put "Reasonable Accommodation" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.



Business Area: Dow Jones - Finance



Job Category: Finance



Union Status:



Non-Union role



Pay Range: $55,000 - $70,000



We recognize that attracting the best talent is key to our strategy and success as a company.As a result, we aim for flexibility in structuring competitive compensation offers to ensure we are able to attract the best candidates.The quoted salary range represents our good faith estimate as to what our ideal candidates are likely to expect, and we tailor our offers within the range based on the selected candidate's experience, industry knowledge, location, technical and communication skills, and other factors that may prove relevant during the interview process.



Pay-for-performance is a key element in our strategy to attract, engage, and motivate talented people to do their best work. Similarly to salary, for bonus eligible roles, targets are set based on a variety of factors including competitive market practice.



For benefits eligible roles, in addition to cash compensation, the company provides a comprehensive and highly competitive benefits package, with a variety of physical health, retirement and savings, caregiving, emotional wellbeing, transportation, and other benefits, including "elective" benefits employees may select to best fit the needs and personal situations of our diverse workforce..



Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world’s top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron’s, MarketWatch and Financial News.



This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.


**If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view "Find Jobs - Dow Jones." Thank you.**

title: Human Resources Assistant
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**

The Human Resources Assistant is responsible for facilitating onboarding and pre-employment clearance and employment law compliance for direct support professional staffing as well as various non-exempt positions. Provides administrative support to the Human Resources Generalist and the Director of Human Resources.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES:**

1. Recruits, interviews and facilitates the hiring of qualified job applicants for open position; collaborates with departmental supervisors to understand skills and competencies required for openings; participates in job fairs/open houses as needed.

2. Collects background information from applications submitted by all potential new hires; which involves all aspects of the background check process.

3. Conducts or acquires background checks and employee eligibility verifications.

4. Personnel file maintenance.

5. Works in conjunction with the HR Generalist in preparing Personnel Action Notices (EIF) and enters all data for employees into the HRIS system, including new hires, terminations and all other personnel status changes. Processes all employee checklist tasks (new hire, termination, transfer)

6. Maintains and updates master schedule as requested.

7. Assists with special projects as requested.

8. Ensures that the employment application and EEO information log is maintained properly.

9. Creates and maintains employee personnel files; maintains I-9 documentation as required.

10. Maintains record keeping of staff call-outs.

11. Handles employment-related inquiries from applicants, employees, supervisors, referring complex and/or sensitive matters to the appropriate staff.

12. Assists the Director of Human Resources with coordinating employee recognition activities (employee luncheon, Holiday Open House, etc.).

13. Performs any other duties as assigned by the Human Resources Generalist and/or Director of Human Resources.

14. Cooperates fully with licensee and Department of Human Services staff in any inspection or investigation.

**QUALIFICATIONS/EDUCATION:**

· Must be at least 18 years old, have a valid NJ Driver’s License with an acceptable record of safe driving

· Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration or related field preferred

· At least 1 year of human resources experience.

· Knowledge of ADP Payroll/Workforce Now

**PLUS**

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.

· Ability to prioritize tasks.

· Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.

**UPON EMPLOYMENT:** 

* Physical exam stating applicant can perform duties of the job.
* Proof of negative drug test results.
* Proof of Mantoux skin test showing negative results.
* Ability to pass a Child Abuse Record Information (CARI) check.
* Ability to pass background checks (fingerprinting, DHS Central Registry, Medicaid Exclusion List)

title: Director of Harm Reduction Services
description:
Job Title: Director of Harm Reduction Services

Department: Harm Reduction Services

Reports To: Vice President of Harm Reduction Services

Location: Harm Reduction Center

Job Summary:

The Director of Harm Reduction works collaboratively with program staff and senior leadership to provide quality program management, contracting, regulatory compliance, and program reporting for the Harm Reductions Services, Medicaid Harm Reduction Services, the FPHNY program, and the Opioid Overdose prevention programs. The Director executes pre and post-award grant administration and budgeting responsibilities. Responsible for monitoring all contracts for compliance, the timely submission of reports, vouchering to funders for reimbursement/payment, and assistance with grant-seeking and proposal development—deep understanding of harm reduction theory and practice.

Primary Duties & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Responsible for the programmatic oversight of all harm reduction programs, including submission of all program reports, monitoring of monthly program/projected service deliverables, and monitoring the quality of data entry and reporting.· Develop and maintain systems and quality improvement initiatives to assess and improve program goals, programmatic performance and efficiency.

· Implement and supervise quality improvement activities, including monitoring quality indicators and reviewing program documentation regularly.

· Provide accurate analysis of program-related contracts and budgets.

· Work with the finance department to manage vouchering, invoicing, and the processing of payments.

· Ensure that the expectations of funders, partners, constituents, clients, and community stakeholders are met.

· Ensure fidelity of implementation of all programs, using data and ongoing feedback to inform and revise program initiatives in collaboration with program leadership.

· Identify service gaps and design effective viable solutions.

· Ensures outreach activities are conducted to increase program census across contracts.

· Oversee and monitor departmental training/development activities.

· Conduct team meetings on a monthly and as-needed basis

· Coordinate community clean-up of syringes.

· Ensure mobile testing, syringe distribution, peer education, and outreach activities are scheduled.

· Coordinate community mapping activities to track informal and formal program expansion in the Bronx.

· Implement Quality Assurance (QA) activities, including monitoring quality improvement indicators and ongoing review of program activity logs and documentation.

· Provide regular and consistent supervision, evaluation, professional development, and oversight of Harm Reduction staff

· Responsible for the management and scheduling of staff

· Maintain an organized inventory system of syringe exchange and outreach program supplies, including ordering new supplies with particular attention paid to program needs and cost efficiency.

· Identify community-based organizations for potential referral services, follow up on existing linkages, and provide agency information sessions and promotional materials for staff and participants as appropriate.

· Enhance linkages with social service providers to facilitate referrals and coordination of services for all persons who test positive and who are at high risk for HIV/HCV/STIs who will receive referrals for needed services and enrollment into Health Homes.

· Ensure that team members follow up on all non-completed referrals to ascertain what barriers to access to care and support services were and work with the client and the referred agency to overcome these barriers.

· Integrate agency SEP, HIV/STI/Hepatitis C prevention and outreach activities with other BOOM!Health direct services, as well as with outside service providers through agreements and linkages.

· Prepare and complete monthly reports, including narrative and quantities data, follow-up and access to services, and document intervention activities in relevant databases.

· Meeting individually with participants to assess needs and program status and provide individuals with program matters and available resources for their needs.

Qualifications/Criteria:

· Experience with and knowledge of the provision of harm reduction services to high risk populations, including active drug users, the homeless and sex workers.

· Minimum 2 years of program and contract management and supervisory experience. Knowledge of harm reduction theory and practice.

· Knowledge of and experience with outcome evaluation development and analysis.

· Excellent organizational skills, including data analysis and programmatic documentation.

· Excellent oral and written communication skills. Assist in the hiring of staff.

· Development of staffing schedules and work assignments for the evening and weekend staff

Education:

Bachelor’s degree or higher with 2 years of management experience in a harm reduction setting

Salary: $75,000.00

DISCLAIMER:

The statements herein are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed for this position. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required for this position. Argus Community, Inc. reserves the right to change, add, or delete, at any time, any part of this job description to meet the needs of the Agency.

title: Payroll Administrator
description:
**Position Summary:**

We are seeking a detail-oriented and organized Payroll Clerk with 3-5 years of experience to join our finance team. The Payroll Clerk will assist in the accurate and timely processing of payroll, ensuring compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements. This role is crucial in maintaining employee satisfaction and trust through meticulous handling of payroll operations.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Payroll Processing:** Assist in preparing and processing bi-weekly or monthly payroll for employees, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and legal regulations.
* **Data Entry:** Input and update employee payroll data, including new hires, terminations, and changes in pay rates.
* **Timekeeping:** Verify and reconcile employee timecards and attendance records.
* **Deductions and Benefits:** Calculate and apply various deductions (e.g., taxes, benefits, garnishments) accurately.
* **Records Maintenance:** Maintain and organize payroll records, ensuring they are up-to-date and easily accessible.
* **Reporting:** Generate payroll reports and summaries as needed for management and audits.
* **Issue Resolution:** Address and resolve payroll discrepancies and employee inquiries in a timely manner.
* **Compliance:** Stay informed about and ensure compliance with federal, state, and local payroll regulations.
* **Collaboration:** Work closely with HR and Finance departments to ensure seamless payroll operations.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:** 3-5 years of experience in payroll processing or a related field.
* **Education:** High school diploma or equivalent; Associate's degree in Accounting, Finance, or a related field is preferred.
* **Skills:**
* Proficiency in payroll software (e.g., ADP, Paychex) and Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, Word).
* Strong numerical and analytical skills.
* Excellent attention to detail and organizational abilities.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written.
* Ability to handle confidential information with integrity and professionalism.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $30.00 - $31.00 per hour

title: Regional Clinical Associate
description:
The Counseling Center:  

Position Title: Regional Clinical Associate  

  

Come join a rapidly expanding, leading national substance abuse organization who is currently seeking a Regional Clinical Associate for their growing Intensive Outpatient Counseling program! We have achieved this remarkable growth by building a reputation for compassionate care, clinical expertise, continuous improvement and a focus on exceeding the expectations of our patients, clients, and their families. At our company, you can enjoy a rewarding career.  

  

Job description:  

The Regional Clinical Associate consults with the CEO, Physician, and Utilization Review Department as needed. The Regional Clinical Associate maintains close communication with the clinical staff, provides any information relevant to the program’s operation and assists in developing and modifying the program. He/she monitors documentation by the clinical staff to ensure that documentation is maintained at the highest level and is responsible to provide 24-hour management of the clinical function of the facility.
  

  

\\*\\*This position supports two TCC facilities. Cherry Hill and Robbinsville  

  

Duties/Responsibilities:  

* Assists in supervising all clinical staff members and activities, which include monitor groups, individual therapy, and charting to maintain the highest standard of quality and effectiveness.
* Coordinates with program administration.
* Works with Utilization Review Department.
* Organizes professional development and training in individual therapy, diagnosis and assessment, group therapy and charting/documentation.
* Monitors and assesses staff morale while developing ongoing plans to build team spirituality and continuity.
* Participates in the recruitment and interview process to determine the appropriateness of prospective clinical staff members.
* Maintains records and documentation relative to clinical staff.

  

Requirements:  

* Master’s Degree in Psychology or Social Work
* Active LSW or LAC
* Knowledge of addiction and mental health a plus

  

Compensation:  

* Salary is competitive with experience and location

  

Full time employees may be eligible for the following:  

* Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision, and STD options

* Career Advancement Opportunities

title: Compliance Manager
description:
**Compliance Manager**

**Location:** Brooklyn, New York

Dolphin Property Services is a real estate property management company specializing in affordable housing properties. We are a growing New York-based Property Management firm looking for a Property Manager to manage and maintain an affordable housing property in the Brooklyn.

**Summary/Objective:** The Compliance Manager will be primarily responsible for overseeing the recertification process, ensuring its timeliness, and verifying that all move-in files adhere to compliance standards set by state programs such as, but not limited to, tax credits, HPD, HFA, Section 8, and other state tax credits. In addition, the Compliance Manager will conduct onsite training and be in charge of preparing for any state agency audits that may occur.

**Essential function/Responsibilities, duties include but are not limited to the following:**

* Supervise and guide onsite recertification specialists/property managers
* Review all recertifications including interim and initial
* Annual audit assistance
* Approval of all move-ins for assigned sites
* Maintaining the recertification tracker to ensure timely completion of all assigned certifications
* Running of scheduled Annual Recertification report and development of plan of action with site team on proactively organizing and completing certifications
* Running of all EIV reporting including annual, 90-day, and ETS
* Ensure LIHTC increases, utility allowances, OCAF are filed timely and correct data is being used throughout assigned portfolio
* Double check billing to ensure there are no discrepancies and any applicable increases have been noticed appropriately and implemented in Yardi
* Meet with site manager and recertification specialist periodically to discuss property needs and develop strategic team approach in achieving compliance goals of no terminations for the assigned site(s)Oversee the processing of all Section-8 lease renewals using Yardi software, ensuring timely submission and accuracy of all documentation to respective Section-8 agencies.
* Lead and direct the work of Compliance Specialists to meet all compliance needs, including recertifications, rent registrations and lease renewals.
* Manage a personal portfolio of units, handling recertifications and other compliance-related duties.
* Ensure compliance with all Public Housing Authority's (PHA) regulatory and leasing requirements for Section 8 Project Based Voucher (PBV) properties.
* Ensure proper leases are signed by residents and submitted online to the PHA in a timely manner.
* Maintain property vacancy list and manage the PHA-provided applicant waiting list.
* Prequalify income and screen applicant referrals for unit vacancies.
* Track and maintain all transfer inquiries and collaborate with PHA on processing requests.
* Handle the collection of rent payments and security deposits, assisting residents with annual and interim recertification requests to PHA.
* Complete review and updating of Tenant Selection Plans for assigned properties.
* Assist at other properties, as needed, as requested by the Director of Compliance based on needs or special projects.

**Requirements:**

* Minimum 2 years’ experience in the field of Property Management, including experience with Section 8
* Previous supervisory experience, a plus
* Familiarity with affordable housing
* Experience managing maintenance staff, a plus.
* Understanding of annual certification
* Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Word, Excel, and Outlook
* Yardi software experience a plus
* Experience working with unions is a plus.
* High School diploma OR GED; Some college, preferred
* Preferred certifications: LIHTC (Low-Income Housing Tax Credit) and TaCC (Tax Credit Compliance).
* Extensive experience with Yardi software and managing Section-8 compliance.
* Proven ability to lead and manage teams in a fast-paced environment.
* Strong organizational, communication, and interpersonal skills.

**Benefits:**

* Medical coverage for the employee full premium paid by DPS. Coverage starts day 1 of employment.
* Dental
* Vision
* 401k with employer matching
* Life insurance
* Annual performance-based bonus
* Additional incentive-based bonus opportunities
* 2 weeks’ vacation per calendar year
* 5 personal days per calendar year
* 5 sick days
* 12 annual paid holidays
* Reimbursement for business travel

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Experience:

* FDA regulations: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Brooklyn, NY: Relocate before starting work (Required)

title: Intern, News
description:
**Job Description :**



The New York Post has been telling stories for over 223 years. Every day, we work relentlessly to uncover and tell the stories you can't resist. Founded as a newspaper, the New York Post has evolved into a national digital brand. Our flagship sites (nypost.com, pagesix.com and decider.com), our digital products and our social channels are infused with the flavor and style of the original newspaper, but also purpose-built for the digital age.



The New York Post is looking for a talented part-time **News Intern** to work approximately 24 hours per week throughout the Fall semester.


***Internship Dates: Sept. 16, 2024 - Nov. 22, 2024 (10 weeks)***


**Primary responsibilities:**


* Report on breaking news stories, working out of City Hall, police bureaus and various courthouses
* Shadow veteran reporters to understand the full scope of the news gathering process
* Stay up to date on breaking news

**Qualifications:**


* Strong news judgment and the ability to make quick, informed decisions
* Ability to work independently and efficiently
* Genuine passion for all things news-related, as well as an understanding of both hard news and entertainment/celebrity culture
* Familiarity with NYC and its surrounding areas is a plus, but not mandatory
* Bilingual in Spanish and/or access to a car a plus!

***Note: NY Post has returned to the office in a hybrid work schedule.***



As an equal opportunity employer, the New York Post does not discriminate in hiring or the terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, color, religion, national origin, age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, citizenship or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. The New York Post will consider the provision of reasonable accommodations to known physical or mental disabilities of otherwise qualified applicants to enable them to participate in our application process and to effectively perform the essential functions of the job, unless doing so would impose an undue financial or operational hardship.


Pay Range: $16/hr - $16/hr



At the New York Post, we’re passionate about providing readers with the best in National News, Sports, Entertainment, and Lifestyle like only the Post can – with wit, irreverence and authority.


**OUR BRANDS:** Include The New York Post (https://nypost.com/) : expert news, extensive, award-winning sports coverage, and insider commentary, Page Six (https://pagesix.com/) : an influential leader in celebrity and entertainment news, Decider.com : helping the on-demand generation discover the best streaming content, and Alexa (https://nypost.com/alexa/) : our luxury lifestyle print edition focused on the best in luxury fashion, real estate and travel.


**OUR REACH:** People love us. We are one of the largest growing digital networks, averaging over 90 million unique visitors a month! Our social footprint continues to expand across Facebook (https://www.facebook.com/NYPost/) , Twitter (https://twitter.com/nypost) , Instagram (https://www.instagram.com/nypost/?hl=en) , TikTok (https://www.tiktok.com/@nypost?lang=en) , and YouTube (https://www.youtube.com/@nypost/videos) , where our videos average 313 million monthly views.


**OUR PEOPLE:** The Post team is a group of diverse, creative, passionate minds – ever evolving and innovating. We believe news doesn’t have to be boring to be news… so we make sure it isn’t!


**OUR GROWTH:** An ever evolving multi-platform media company, we span print, digital, video, social, podcast, app, commerce/affiliate, original TV programming, and Post Sports+ (https://nypost.com/account/subscribe) , our newly launched Sports membership experience!


**We’re growing. Come join us!**


Equal Opportunity Employer


All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets

title: Quality Clinical Review Specialist RN
description:
**JOB PURPOSE:**

Under the direction of the SDR Unit Lead, the **Quality Review Specialist** is responsible for reviewing, triaging, process, and/or investigating, as necessary, all service determination requests received. Will perform a quality review of all data submitted by the IDT teams and PACE Service Coordinators in Care Compass. The role will ensure that service determination requests (SDRs) are handled in a timely and efficient manner and in compliance with the relevant policies & procedures. The role will also perform a variety of duties involving entering, confirming, and updating patient service support documentation. This will include frequent communication with participants and collaboration with various teams within to collect and process participant data effectively.

**JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:**

- Reviews daily tasks and assigns SDR cases for coordination with IDT and timely resolution.

- Provides all administrative-related information and routes accordingly for proper clinical review.

- Completes SDR assessments and coordination notes into the Care Compass EMR database related to the SDR process, approved services, delivered services, etc.

- Collaborates with the inter-disciplinary team (IDT), CSDs, and care delivery supervisors to ensure service determination requests (SDRs) are completed in a timely manner.

- Works closely with the site-associated Care Delivery department to ensure data is entered correctly and in a timely manner.

- Reviews documentation completeness related to the rationale for all service determination requests (SDRs) IDT decisions.

- Outreaches participants, caregivers, representatives, IDT members, and others to keep them informed about the status or resolution of requests.

- Keeps IDT members updated with SDR process status.

- Coordinates, documents & follows up with staff in different departments issues and/or requests resolutions.

- Completes assigned daily/weekly notification calls for all SDR decisions, including appeal rights information for denials and partial approvals.

- Completes validation calls to participants, caregivers, or representatives to confirm that all approved services were received timely.

- Prepares detailed written responses to all participants/caregivers/representatives regarding the resolution of the service request.

- Responsible for completing, scanning/uploading into EMR all denial letters, including date-stamped mailing envelopes.

- Assists with follow-up and escalation of the SDR step process as necessary.

- Provides general administrative support as needed.

- Monitors daily and weekly pending SDR case reports.

- Maintains departmental quality and productivity goals.

- Adheres to all applicable compliance requirements and the Code of Conduct.

**Weekly Hours:** 40

**Schedule:** Monday - Friday, 8:30 AM - 5:30 PM

**Salary Range:** $105,000.00 - $110,000.00

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

**EDUCATION:** Bachelor's or Associate degree in Nursing.

**Additional Requirements:**

- Able to pass typing-test with at least 45 WPM

- Excellent written and verbal communication skills (grammar, spelling, and punctuation)

- Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment and meet assigned deadlines

- Excellent organizational skills, accuracy, and attention to detail

- Demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and be flexible.

- Ability to operate both independently and collaboratively as required

- Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, including Word, Excel and Outlook

**Physical Requirements**

Individuals must be able to sustain certain physical requirements essential to the job. This includes, but is not limited to:

- **Standing** – Duration of up to 6 hours a day.

- **Sitting/Stationary Positions** – Sedentary position in duration of up to 6-8 hours a day for consecutive hours/periods.

- **Lifting/Push/Pull** – Up to 50 pounds of equipment, baggage, supplies, and other items used in the scope of the job using OSHA guidelines, etc.

- **Bending/Squatting** – Have to be able to safely bend or squat to perform the essential functions under the scope of the job.

- **Stairs/Steps/Walking/Climbing** – Must be able to safely maneuver stairs, climb up/down, and walk to access work areas.

- **Agility/Fine Motor Skills** - Must demonstrate agility and fine motor skills to operate and activate equipment, devices, instruments, and tools to complete essential job functions (ie. typing, use of supplies, equipment, etc.)

- **Sight/Visual Requirements** – Must be able to visually read documentation, papers, orders, signs, etc., and type/write documentation, etc. with accuracy.

- **Audio Hearing and Motor Skills (Language) Requirements** – Must be able to listen attentively and document information from patients, community members, co-workers, clients, providers, etc., and intake information through audio processing with accuracy. In addition, they must be able to speak comfortably and clearly with language motor skills for customers to understand the individual.

- **Cognitive Ability** – Must be able to demonstrate good decision-making, reasonableness, cognitive ability, rational processing, and analysis to satisfy essential functions of the job.

title: Vice President Credit Manager
description:
Job description
Our purpose – Opening up a world of opportunity – explains why we exist. Here at HSBC we use our unique expertise, capabilities, breadth and perspectives to open up new kinds of opportunity for our more than 40 million customers. We’re bringing together the people, ideas and capital that nurture progress and growth, helping to create a better world – for our customers, our people, our investors, our communities and the planet we all share.  

  

Credit Management provides front line credit and risk ownership including writing credit papers, performing credit analysis, modeling projection and enterprise valuation analysis, coordinating with internal stakeholders (such as Credit Risk, relationship managers, global partners, and product teams), and delivering sound recommendations based on robust business, relationship, and industry analysis using expert judgment and conforming with internal credit policies/guidelines and external regulatory requirements.  

  

As our Vice President Credit Manage you will:


* Deliver the business strategy with strong knowledge of Commercial Banking (CMB) and ISB priorities
* Build strategic and valued relationships with customers, applying knowledge to provide value-add advice and assistance
* Adhere to HSBC policies, procedures, and control requirements and raise any concerns about actual or potential issues promptly, in line with reporting and escalation procedures
* Ensure all actions take into account the likelihood of operational risk occurring, addressing areas of concern in conjunction with Risk and relevant colleagues and ensuring that actions resulting from internal/external audits and external regulators are correctly implemented in a timely fashion
* Appropriate conduct is integral to HSBC values and principles and supports all business activities including the Group’s growth strategy, culture and behaviors, interaction with customers, financial markets operations, and governance and oversight processes. All employees must demonstrate the HSBC vision, values, goals, and culture in personal behavior, actions, and decision making

For this role, HSBC targets a pay range between $95,600.00 and $143,400.00  

  

The final fixed pay offer will depend on the candidate and a number of variables, including but not limited to, role responsibilities, skill set, depth of experience and education, licensing/certification requirements, internal relativity, and specific work location.  

  

At HSBC, our overall goal is to provide a competitive Total Reward Package, with an appropriate mix of fixed pay, and variable pay, as part of an employee’s overall total compensation and benefits. Variable pay generally takes the form of discretionary, annual awards (sometimes referred to as a “bonus”). Additionally, HSBC offers a wide range of competitive and flexible benefits designed to help you improve your health and well-being, finances, and lifestyle.


Requirements
You´ll likely have the following qualifications to succeed in this role:


* Ability to analyze situations effectively and make well-thought out decisions
* Proven leadership skills including coaching, motivation and communications skills to inspire others
* Strong teamwork skills promoting an environment of co-operation and trust, overcoming resistance where encountered
* Strong analytical and financial skills
* Excellent prioritizing, organizational and time management abilities
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills

In compliance with applicable laws, HSBC is committed to employing only those who are authorized to work in the U.S. Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the U.S. as HSBC will not engage in immigration sponsorship for this position.  

  

As an HSBC employee, you will have access to tailored professional development opportunities to ensure you have the right skills for today and tomorrow. We offer a competitive pay and benefits package including a robust Wellness Hub, all in a welcoming, diverse and inclusive work environment. You will be empowered to drive HSBC’s engagement with the communities we serve through an industry-leading volunteerism policy, a generous matching gift program, and a comprehensive program of immersive Sustainability and Climate Change Initiatives. You’ll want to join our Employee Resource Groups as they play a central part in life at HSBC, including the development of our employees and networking inside and outside of HSBC. We value difference. We succeed together. We take responsibility. We get it done. And we want you to help us build the bank of the future!  

  

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, race, national origin, ethnicity, disability or medical condition, genetic information, military or veteran service, religion, creed, sex, gender, pregnancy, childbirth, caregiver status, marital status, citizenship or immigration status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression or any other trait protected by applicable law.
