title: CL A 100% No Touch Dry Van -90-100K/YR Home Every Other W/End
description:
Seeking top-tier Class A drivers for an exceptional opportunity! Enjoy an 11-day driving cycle with a full 3-day weekend off every other week. Please carefully review the requirements below, as only candidates meeting all criteria will be considered.


**Key Highlights:**



* 11 days on the road, followed by a relaxing 3-day weekend home every other week.
* 100% no-touch freight with an average fleet pay of $90-$100K/Yr.
* Mileage pay ranges from $.67 to $.71 CPM, contingent on experience and hazmat endorsement (not required).
* State-of-the-art equipment: newer model Freightliners and KW T680 with amenities like flat-screen TVs, 1500 watt inverters, microwaves, fridges, and XM radio.
* Operating exclusively in IL, KY, IN, OH, PA, MD, WV, VA, CT, NC, DE, MA, CT, RI - no routes through NY state, NYC, or Long Island.
* Great benefits and a bonus program for clean inspections.
* Recognizing and treating top-performing drivers with the utmost respect, resulting in one of the industry's lowest turnover rates.


**Requirements:**



* Minimum 9 months verifiable Class A OTR or Regional experience in the last 15 months with at least 2 months in winter weather conditions
* Clean MVR with no DOT preventable accidents in the last 3 years.
* No SAP drivers - must not have failed a DOT Drug or Alcohol test.
* No major moving violations in the last 3 years, encompassing both personal and CMV.
* No DOT recordable accidents in the last 4 years, with no more than one incident in the last 18 months.
* No more than 5 jobs held in the last 3 years.
* No DUI in a personal motor vehicle (PMV) in the last 7 years, and only one in a lifetime.


If you meet all these requirements and are ready to join a team that values and rewards excellence, apply now for an unparalleled driving experience!

title: CL A Dedicated Tanker & Hazmat - 1925/WK Salary Out 21 Home 6-8 Days
description:
We're actively seeking dedicated Class A drivers to join our team, running dedicated regional routes with a fantastic starting pay of $300/Day for all drivers. Your earnings will increase up to $324/Day, with a $3/Day pay raise every 6 months. Drivers must hold Hazmat and Tanker endorsements, along with a minimum of 1-year verifiable Class A driving experience (preferably Tanker OTR, but no OTR experience or Tanker? No worries – we provide training).


**Key Highlights:**



* Dedicated regional runs to one client, based on customer needs, covering various regional areas in the continental US. Regions include FL, NV to NM, TX, St Louis, and more.
* Company pays for your flight home during home time if you are not within 200 miles to drive. If you choose to drive, ensure you have a secure parking location or park at your house.
* Trucks are not slip-seated; they are 100% assigned to drivers, and they are newer model Peterbilts.
* Flexible run/home time options: 21 days out with 5-7 days home or over 21 days out with a minimum of 7 days home.
* Running a cryogenic tanker with no cryogenic experience needed. Some tanker experience is required, and hazmat endorsement is a must.


Compensation and Benefits:



* $1500 sign-on bonus ($500 after orientation and $1000 after 30 days)
* First-year pay ranges from $86,000 to $106,000.
* Full training provided on cryogenic deliveries at $125/Day.
* Full benefits kick in after 60 days, including medical, vision, dental, PTO, 401K, and cell phone reimbursement.


Requirements:



* One-year verifiable Class A OTR or Regional driving experience in the last 3 years with at least some tanker experience.
* Must have Hazmat and Tanker endorsements; those with tanker or cryogenic experience will be expedited.
* Cannot be SAP – no failed or refused drug test ever.
* Relatively clean MVR
* No more than 5 jobs in the last 3 years, avoiding job hopping.


Join us for a fulfilling career offering exceptional daily pay and the best home time in the industry

title: Accounts Payable and Office Assistant
description:
Accounts Payable and Office Assistant
**Your Wireless – Verizon Wireless Premium Retailer**
Location: Westbury, NY
**Compensation:** Up to $20.00 per hour plus amazing employee benefits and perks.
Full Time  


**Your Wireless,** a Verizon Wireless Premium Retailer, is seeking detail-oriented and organized individual to join our team as an Accounts Payable and Office Assistant. In this role, you will be responsible for managing accounts payable functions while providing administrative support to ensure the smooth operation of our office. The ideal candidate will possess strong numerical skills, excellent communication abilities, and a proactive approach to problem-solving.
**As an Accounts Payable – Office Assistant for Your Wireless, you will enjoy some great perks:**
* Strong base-pay and annual assessment for Pay increases
* Flexible Work Schedule.
* 401k savings program.
* Great Healthcare program.
* Personal Time Off. Year 1 is 5 paid days off per year. Year 2 is 10 paid days off per year. Year 3 and beyond, 15 paid days off per year.
* Employee discounts on Verizon Wireless Service
* Employee discounts on devices and accessories
* Great and fun working atmosphere.
* Significant opportunities to grow in our company.


**As an Accounts Payable – Office Assistant for Your Wireless, you will be:**
* Processing invoices accurately and efficiently.
* Verifying invoices for accuracy, including matching invoices to purchase orders, and receiving documents.
* Obtaining proper approval for payment of invoices.
* Preparing and perform electronic payments or issue checks.
* Reconciling vendor statements and resolve discrepancies in a timely manner.
* Maintaining organized and up-to-date accounts payable records.
* Assisting in maintaining office operations by handling various administrative tasks.
* Managing incoming and outgoing correspondence, including mail and emails.
* Answering and directing phone calls to appropriate parties.
* Coordinating meetings, appointments, and travel arrangements for staff.
* Maintaining office supplies inventory and place orders as necessary.
* Assisting in organizing company events and activities.
* Accurately entering financial data into accounting software or spreadsheets.
* Maintaining an organized filing system for invoices, receipts, and other financial documents.
* Assisting in generating reports and financial statements as needed.
* Collaborating with other team members to resolve issues and streamline processes.
* Providing support to other departments as needed.


**Your Wireless** requires candidates for the Accounts Payable and office Assistant position candidates have the following skills and experiences:
* High school diploma or equivalent; Associate degree in accounting or related field preferred.
* Proven experience in accounts payable or a similar role.
* Proficiency in accounting software and MS Office, particularly Excel and Word.
* Strong attention to detail and accuracy in data entry.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills.
* Effective communication skills, both written and verbal.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.
* Prioritize tasks and manage workload effectively.
* Familiarity with basic office equipment and procedures.
* Knowledge of generally accepted accounting principles (GAAP) is a plus.
* Must be 18 years of age or older and able to provide proof of work eligibility in the US.

  


**About Your Wireless**
Your Wireless is proud to be the largest minority-owned Verizon Authorized Retailer. Our diversity and employee-first culture fill our 130+ stores across 16 States with over 400 of the best wireless experts on earth. Our motto of “Be really, really nice, know your $#%@, and always find a way,” guides our team to deliver a best-in-class customer experience through simplicity. We don’t like to complicate things.
To learn more about Your Wireless visit www.YourWirelessInc.com  


**Your Wireless Inc.,** is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in employment based on race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding/lactation, and related medical conditions), age, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, citizenship status, military/veteran status, and any other characteristic under applicable federal, state, or local law.
company_description: Your Wireless Inc. is a top performing "Premium Agent" for Verizon Wireless, the nation's largest wireless service provider.

title: CL A Drivers Run I-35 East-100% No Touch -Pet and Rider OK
description:
Class A drivers with one year experience run East of I-35, out 10-14 days, starting pay based on experience with a .20CPM per diem and ONLY URINE for drug test.


**What We Offer:**



* Drivers run 10-14 days depending on how they want to run and will run 2000-2800 miles per week
* All freight is no touch dry van and is 20-30% live unload.
* Starting pay ranges $.505 - $.565 CPM with $.20 of that being per diem
* Drivers can take rider and pets with them
* Will NOT run NYC, Long Island or the Burroughs.
* Full medical, dental, 401K, Paid Time Off after 60 days with the company
* We ONLY do urine test - NO HAIR
* Will accept auto restrictions


CAN NOT TAKE ANYONE THAT HAS A FAILED DOT DRUG OR ALCOHOL TEST EVER



**Requirements:**



* Clean Record: No failed DOT drug or alcohol tests ever.
* Experience: Minimum 12 months of verifiable Class A driving experience in the last three years. This can be local, regional or OTR
* Flexible Restrictions: Auto restrictions accepted.
* Safe Driving: Maximum of 3 moving violations in the last three years, with no more than one in the last 12 months.
* Safety First: No reckless driving, following too closely, texting/talking while driving, or major traffic violations.
* No DOT Preventable accidents that involve rear end, roll over, jack kniff in the last 3 years

title: Veterinary Technician
description:
**Veterinary Technician**
**Animal Hospital of Linden**
We are seeking experienced veterinary technicians to join our busy small animal veterinary hospital in Linden, NJ. We practice both the art and the science of veterinary medicine to the highest degree, advocating for each pet and educating each pet owner to provide the most complete care. Compassion describes our outlook. Our staff enjoys a well-equipped hospital, including ultrasound, digital dental radiography, complete laboratory, therapeutic laser, and more. In addition to regular small animal practice services, we offer good working hours, generous benefits including health insurance and retirement plan, and pleasant working conditions.


You should be a good communicator and confident with both people and animals. You should have excellent technical skills, be good with your hands, and be kind. You must be trustworthy and be motivated to do your best work each and every day. A positive outlook on life and work is very helpful.
We believe in a Whole Person Approach when it comes to our veterinary teams. This includes a living wage for all hospital Team Members, best-in-class benefits, mental health support, and continuous education. Investing in our teams and sharing the growth that they are instrumental in driving are top priorities, which is why every Team Member is eligible to participate in our revenue sharing program as well. All positions come with growth opportunities – whether you are seeking skill development to advance your career or to build additional capacity to better serve your community, we custom tailor plans for each Team Member’s career journey.


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Checks patient medical records for past histories, enters treatments and charges in computer.\\*
* Restrains animals for veterinarian as required.\\*
* Maintains and communicates client educational material in an efficient manner.\\*
* Applies knowledge and skills in drawing blood, accessing veins quickly, and minimizing patient discomfort to perform testing procedures.\\*
* Performs specimen testing procedures accurately on blood, urine, and other samples according to medical orders using all related equipment and computers.\\*
* Assists veterinarian with in-patient nursing care in daily treatments to include maintaining and calculating IV fluids, IV catheter placement and maintenance, administering hospital medications, wound care, nutrition, and patient assessment.\\*
* Performs anesthesia induction, monitoring, and recovery.\\*
* Obtains diagnostic quality dental radiographs, chart dental abnormalities, perform dental scaling and polishing, assist veterinarian with oral surgery\\*
* Induces, maintains, and recovers patients for general anesthesia including monitoring vital signs\\*
* Prepares patients for surgery including clipping and sterile skin prep, proper positioning, assisting in surgery\\*
* Communicates with clients describing prescribed medication, possible complications and warnings.\\*
* Utilizes computer system to enter and reference patient information as needed.\\*
* Performs necessary lab work including CBC's, blood chemistry profiles, urinalysis, heartworm tests, FELV/FIV tests, fecal tests, cultures and sensitivities and fungal cultures.\\*
* Documents test results and delivers to appropriate personnel promptly.\\*
* Prepares specimens for mailing to laboratories according to practice requirements.\\*
* Assures all necessary exam room materials are readily available.\\*
* Schedules and/or performs routine maintenance and quality controls of laboratory equipment, and provides training to other staff as required.\\*
* Ensures cleanliness of exam room at all times.\\*
* Perform radiographic imaging including entry of patient information, proper positioning of patient and radiographic technique for diagnostic quality images, and preparing forms and images to be e-mailed or referred as needed.\\*
* Takes medical histories and examination of patients, reviews routine vaccinations and testing for currency, administers vaccines and medications according to veterinarians orders.\\*
* Performs departmental housekeeping duties.\\*
* Admits and discharges patients.\\*
* Takes, processes and logs prescription refills in-house, call out pharmacy and online pharmacy.\\*
* Other duties as assigned.


**Skills:**


* Dentistry
* Intravenous catheter placement administration


**Benefits:**


* Health insurance
* Dental insurance
* Vision insurance
* Short-term disability
* Life insurance
* 401k with match
* Employee assistance program
* Paid Time Off
* LVT school assistance and Continuing education!

title: Facultative Casualty Broker
description:
At Amwins, we succeed together — and have a good time doing it.
We know people don't leave companies. They leave cultures — which is why we work so hard on ours. At Amwins, we thrive on collaboration, not cutthroat competition. Our teams work together to help each other succeed, and we do right by our clients so they can do right by theirs.
First and foremost, we invest in our employees. That investment shows in everything we do; education and development programs, comprehensive and competitive benefits, and an organizational structure that's 43% owned by employee shareholders.
Our commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion helps cultivate an open, welcoming workplace that reflects the communities we serve. You will have the opportunity volunteer within Amwins through a wide range of committees and in your community through the Amwins Foundation and Summer of Service.
Working at Amwins means you love what you do, how you do it and, ultimately, who you do it with. Whether it's today or 150 years from now, we continue to invest in our culture and your development so opportunities for growth and career advancement are never in short supply.
At Amwins, we win together — and have a good time doing it.

Amwins Re, LLC is a national brokerage specializing in the placement of facultative property and casualty reinsurance and program administration. Learn more about Amwins Re here.
We see you in Amwins blue! Join our Amwins Re team! This position will be in person from any Amwins office location in the United States. View our office locations here.
As part of the broker team, you will work closely in collaboration with other team members and clients focusing on the development of reinsurance solutions.
**Each Facultative Casualty Broker is a vital member or our team.**
* Direct focus on new Facultative broking production
	+ producing new business and assisting in the development of sales and marketing strategy designed to cultivate revenue generation opportunities
* Develops comprehensive new business sales and development plans for identified targeted prospects and existing clients
* Works closely in collaboration with Amwins wholesale broking teams to focus efforts on the development of new business and building relationships with clients and prospects that align with Facultative business targets, with the understanding that volume of prospecting activity is essential
* Identifies specific client and prospect needs and develops innovative and cost effective solutions
* Continues to cultivate a thorough understanding and knowledge of all available Amwins resources and solutions available, and matching those to client business requirements
* Achieves high client satisfaction by providing exceptional service
* Fosters and promotes a team approach to both internal and external business relationships

**We are looking for people with:**
* A minimum of **3-5 years broking and/or underwriting commercial lines experience**, with a focus on casualty insurance
* **Facultative Reinsurance** experience is preferred
* Bachelor’s degree
* CPCU or ARE designation or progression towards is preferred but not required
* Excellent knowledge and understanding of **commercial casualty insurance**
* Ability to travel
**Snapshot of what Amwins provides to our team members:**
* Compensation includes a salary commensurate with experience
* Position eligible for annual bonus
* Broad benefits package available
	+ Most benefits available first day of employment
	+ Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, etc
	+ Paternal Leave, Adoption Assistance, Travel Reimbursement for healthcare, Retail Discount Program, Scholarships for dependents of Amwins employees, etc
* Generous Paid Time Off and Company Holiday Schedule
* Collaborative, continuing education focused work environment
*The above is intended to describe the general content of and requirements for the performance of this job. It is not to be construed as an exhaustive statement of duties, responsibilities or physical requirements. Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.*
